availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Frankfort, Franklin County, Kentucky, grocer and basket maker. Native of Germany. Married to Margaret Buchter Kahr in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on May 20, 1849. Father of Diana Kahr, Margaret Kahr, Elizabeth Kahr, Wilhelmina Kahr, Catharine Kahr, Adam Kahr, and Mary Kahr. Basket marker in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Grocer in Frankfort in 1860. Basket maker in Frankfort in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville District 3, p. 286B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort District 1, p. 248.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 7, p. 16B.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Franklin County, KY, July 1863, p. 7.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482707.
"Our Dead," The Frankfort Roundabout (Frankfort, KY), November 29, 1884, p. 2.
"Adam Kahr (1826-1884)," Find A Grave, Memorial 148700231, accessed November 14, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/148700231.
